doc.after: The identification of Jesus as the Messiah is not accepted by Judaism The term for a Christian in Hebrew is Notzri Nazarene a Talmudic term originally derived from the fact that Jesus came from the Galilean village of Nazareth today in northern Israel 18 Adherents of Messianic Judaism are referred to in modern Hebrew as Yehudim Meshihi im Messianic Jews
